alerts.webSerialNotSupported: This browser does not support the Web Serial API. Use Chrome, Edge, or another Chromium-based browser.
alerts.serialMonitorReconnectNotice: Serial monitor closed — click Connect to re-enter maintenance mode.

spiffs.disconnectState: Connect to an ESP32 to browse and edit SPIFFS files.

viewerDialog.title: Preview
viewerDialog.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support audio playback.

littlefs.disconnectState: Connect to an ESP32 with a LittleFS partition to use these tools.
littlefs.emptyStateMessage: No LittleFS files found. Read the partition or upload to begin.

fatfs.disconnectState: Connect to an ESP32 with a FATFS partition to use these tools.

apps.disconnectState: Connect to a device to inspect OTA application slots.

flash.disconnectState: Connect to your board to flash firmware or inspect registers.

busyDialog.message: The selected serial port is busy. Close any other apps or tabs using it and try again.
busyDialog.tryAgain: If you just disconnected from another tool, wait a moment for the OS to release the port.

bootDialog.title: Connection Tips
description: We couldn't communicate with the board. Try putting your ESP32 into bootloader mode:
Press and hold the BOOT button and keep it held down.
Tap RESET, then release only the RESET button.
While still holding BOOT, click Connect.
Release the BOOT button once the log shows the ESP-ROM banner or the connection completes.

about.title: About ESPConnect
description: ESPConnect is a browser-based toolkit for ESP32 devices. It brings common maintenance tasks together so you can connect, inspect and update your board without installing desktop utilities.

The application talks to the device over the Web Serial API, then exposes high-level tools for firmware flashing, partition management, filesystem editing, backup/restore workflows, as well as a session log and serial monitor for troubleshooting.

about.title: Filesystem Tools
description: SPIFFS: TypeScript emulator for staging changes locally before writing flash.
LittleFS: Full-featured LittleFS v2 implementation with file upload, download, backup, and restore.
FATFS: Read and write FATFS partitions with support for large files and directory structures.
Drag-and-drop uploads, preview/listen for common file types, diff summaries, and mandatory backups before saving keep the workflow safe.

about.title: Firmware & Maintenance
description: Flash custom binaries with progress tracking, presets, and safety prompts.
Inspect partition tables, OTA slots, device descriptors, and flash usage at a glance.
Serial monitor with command shortcuts and session logging for troubleshooting.

about.title: Safety-first Workflow
description: Every destructive action is gated behind confirmation prompts and recent backups. ESPConnect keeps staged changes in-memory until you explicitly write them to flash, making it easy to review modifications or revert by re-reading the partition.

about.title: Privacy & Security
description: ESPConnect runs fully in your browser—there is no backend, account, or telemetry. Firmware files, backups, and diagnostics stay local and only move when you download them yourself. Always flash firmware from trusted sources.

disconnect.title: No device connected
disconnect.subtitle: Connect to an ESP32 to continue.

info.disconnectState: Connect to an ESP32 to view device information.

empty.title: No partition data yet
empty.subtitle: Connect to an ESP32 to load its partition table.

fsManager.backupDone: Download a backup image first (use the "Backup" button once per session). "Save to Flash"becomes available after any successful backup made during this connection.
fsManager.backupAlert: Changes are staged locally until you click “Save to Flash”. A recent backup ensures you can recover if something goes wrong.

empty.title: No Partitions
empty.subtitle: Connect a device and refresh to load partition information

warning.advancedUser: Firmware tools are intended for advanced users. Writing or erasing flash can permanently remove data or render the microcontroller unbootable. Double-check settings before proceeding.

firmwareFlash.title: Flash Firmware
firmwareFlash.baudHint: Flashing runs at {defaultBaud} bps by default. Drop the baud if the device struggles to sync. The serial monitor automatically switches to {monitorBaud} bps for stability.

flashIntegrity.title: Flash Integrity
flashIntegrity.partitionAutoFill: Selecting a partition will auto-fill the offset and length fields below.

serialMonitor.title: Serial Monitor
serialMonitor.subtitle: Console run at 115200 bps automatically for reliable output. Flashing uses the baud rate selected in the toolbar.

info.alert: Starting the serial monitor closes the bootloader connection, resets the board into normal firmware mode, and releases the USB port so the browser stops access once you exit. Reconnect with the main "Connect" button before running maintenance (flash, partition tools, etc.).

terminal.empty: Monitor output will appear here once started.

sessionLog.title: Session Log
sessionLog.emptyText: Logs will appear here once actions begin.

copy.error: Unable to copy log. Please try again.
